H0.text: Ice melting is an example of an exothermic process that involves the absorption and release of energy.

H1.text: Ice sublimating is an example of an exothermic process that releases energy.

H2.text: Water evaporating is an example of an exothermic process in which energy is absorbed and released.

H3.text: Water freezing is an example of an exothermic process, in which energy is released as water transitions from liquid to solid.

A4.text: The energy released upon freezing is a latent heat, and is known as the enthalpy of fusion and is exactly the same as the energy required to melt the same amount of the solid.

A5.text: Freezing is almost always an exothermic process, meaning that as liquid changes into solid, heat and pressure are released.
